data.title: Delicious Dinner and Great Service
data.text: Enjoyed a delicious Chicken Parmesan, mixed green salad, and homemade vanilla gelato with raspberry sauce. Service was prompt and personable. I'll be going again.

data.title: Would not reccommend
data.text: Will never go back. Terrible service! Was overcharged  and treated terribly when I went back. I was treated terribly when I went back.

data.title: Promise not Delivered
data.text:
Cafe Italia opened several years back with such promise!  The menu was daring and unconventional: new takes on old Italian standards!  The place was often busy and it was well situated on the newly trendy Montana Avenue, right in the heart of old Downtown Billings.
Travel forward a few years and it's a lonely shadow of its former self with no ambiance to speak of and very few patrons.  The last time I was in there the menu was unchanged but the chef (I would guess and untrained one) clearly didn't have a grip on traditional Italian cuisine, much less avante guarde.  Our waitress was more interested in talking with friends, there was a huge flatscreen TV tuned to nothing a patron would watch, and not much attention to service or much of anything.
The Caesar Salad is unique and used to be interesting, but it's old hat now.  The other dishes we had were drab.

data.title: Fantastic and unique food
data.text:
Love this restaurant! Never seen it crowded.  Very friendly knowledgable service, and terrific food.  The Calamari is some of the best I've ever had.  It is topped with a sprinkle of melted cheeses and thin slices of mushrooms , and served in a brown paper bag. The dipping sauce that is served with it is just perfect.  Eat it with a spoon.  
There is always an interesting creation available, and there is  even live music- maybe every weekend, I'm not certain.  
Make sure you put Cafe Italian on your list!

data.title: Compliments to the chef!
data.text: Wow, this food was unique and delicious! Unsure why it was empty when we were there; but we enjoyed the food! Ambiance is beautiful and bathroom was super clean.

data.title: Family run Italian restaurant
data.text: The food was good, the flavor was there nothing exciting about the presentation. The dessert was formula/ cash and carry type served.

data.title: Great pizza Average service
data.text: Pizza here is really good. Even my wife's on gluten free crust was excellent. Waitress seemed distracted. Not bad just a little on the lazy side. We would have ordered more such as drinks or desert is she had asked.

data.title: The owner needs to step up or this place is going to fail.
data.text:
Traveling back through Billings from Yellowstone we stopped in the historic downtown area and walked around. We decided to eat here based on other good reviews and the look of the place once we were standing in front of it. The restaurant has a great look and feel to it. The sort of place you might expect to have the best Italian meal of your life! 

While the meals we had were fine, they were far from exquisite. The real problem however was the lack of staff. Any hope you might have of discovering a little gem owned and run by an expat Italian are dashed as soon as the teenager in a t-shirt shuffles up to your table with a bowl of bread but forgets the water. At that point you realize you're in for a very different kind of experience. 

I'm an avid supporter of small businesses, only though, if they are really trying and the owner actually cares. There was one server for the entire place on a busy weekend night. There was 7 or 8 tables full as far as we could tell and this one poor server was run off her feet. She was really trying to make it work and very clearly struggled to do the best she could but it was painful to watch. There should have been at least two servers. One person cannot greet, seat, take orders and deliver to that many tables. The teenage boy who gave us our bread we later learned was her son and he was only seen randomly. We assume he wasn't actually on payroll? 

Where was the owner? Apparently there had only been with one server now for weeks. Why was the owner not at the restaurant helping with this staffing shortage? Especially on a weekend. 

As mentioned, we did enjoy our meal and we tipped well as we could see our server was under a lot of stress. This kind of situation though is the kind of thing that would prevent us from going back if we lived there. If this place is going to survive the owner is going to need to become a little more serious about helping out and fixing this staff shortage.

data.title: Chef is a genius!
data.text: I don't usually eat pasta but decided to be adventurous. I had the butternut squash stuffed ravioli with blue cheese sauce and candied walnuts and 3 weeks later, I cannot stop thinking about it. I have never had this experience in a restaurant before. Every mouthful was a bite of heaven. I wanted to hug the chef but had to settle for having the server relay my kudos to him. I believe this was a once in a lifetime meal.

data.title: Blah
data.text: Food was tasteless, the server was great though. Didn't know is was possible to make Italian food with so little flavor.

data.title: Good food.
data.text: This restaurant is in the Historic center of Billings.  Very good Italian food with reasonable prices.

data.title: One of the Top 10 Restaurants in Billings
data.text:
Best Italian Restaurant in Billings.
Menu includes the typical Italian pasta dishes plus a variety of meat, fish, and rice dishes.  All of the dishes are well done - fresh and delicious!
Atmosphere is casual.  Staff is friendly.  Service is Prompt.

data.title: Homey Italian comfort food with gluten free options!
data.text:
I was attracted to Cafe Italia by the warm glow of its neon sign on Montana Avenue--right in the heart of Billings' historic district and wasn't disappointed. Everything was as it presented itself to be.  But the nicest surprise of all were the gluten free options for both pizza and pasta.  It was a few dollars more, but just having such a wide selection was well worth it, and typical wherever you find it offered.  

I would make the distinction here between Italian and Italian-American.  If you're looking for the Italian comfort food we all grew up with, this is absolutely the place.  In addition, they also have a very smart beverage menu.  I ordered a margherita pizza with the gluten free crust, and a great glass of Chianti.  The drink menu also offered some classic Italian cocktails that I might have tried if I had the chance to come back.  I took some spaghetti and meatballs to go for a friend, and it did not disappoint.  It's the kind of meal that makes you smile as soon as you take the first bite--just like mama used to make.

data.title: Great food, atmosphere,and service
data.text:
We were the early birds on a Saturday.  Being new to Billings our waitress spent a great deal of time sharing with our family all the activities Billings has to offer.  Much appreciated!  For the food my wife ordered a sangria that was house made and delicious.  My kids ordered fettuccine Alfredo that was made from scratch with a great sauce.  My wife ordered a pizza that was good, but not quite the best.  I ordered the special chicken dish.  It had great flavor, the chicken was tasty but a little over cooked.  But not enough to merit a bad review.

Cafe Italia is one we will be back for more

data.title: Very good food in downtown Billings.
data.text:
It seemed to be a slow night when we got there.  We were a group of 3 and waiting for the everyone to arrive was not unpleasant.  The waitress was social and music was soft.

We ordered an appetizer of meatball sliders.  They were great.  Then came our food.  Between us we had a variety of sauces and meats and pastas.  Whether the sauce was red or white, it was delicious.  Let's face it, Italian food is always a little on the 'heavy' side.  The waitress had no problem boxing up our 'leftovers.'  I ate mine the next day and the meal was even better!  I will certainly eat here again whether I am dining alone or with friends.

data.title: Excellent homage Italian food
data.text: Let me first start with their friendly service. Cannot beat that. Second the newest version of Sangria is the best I have had in Billings. It is a must try. My partner had veal parmigiana which was done perfectly and will be my ne t try there. We will definitely return. My spaghetti and meatballs were great. The meatballs were very moist, not the usual dried up ones. Small place but excellent

data.title: Found It By accident
data.text:
We were driving around trying to find a place for dinner.  We didn't want to go to any place we could go to at home (Cracker Barrel, Carinas, etc.).  We drove into "historic Billings" and saw a number of places and this one tickled our fancy.

It has several outdoor tables and about 10-15 tables & booths inside.  It is in an old building and the actual brick walls have been revealed, cleaned and make the place warm and cozy.

As the name implies, it is Italian fare including pizza.  The price are reasonable for Billings and the service was pretty good.  There were only two servers to handle the inside and outside.

Both couples ordered salad and a pizza.  Our Caesar salad was very well dressed and the croutons were tasty.  We ordered a pizza with pepperoni, Italian sausage, and bacon.  It was heavily topped with the meats and cheese and was a little thicker than thin crust.  It was delicious.  The only mishap was the server let our plate the pie on it slip and we lost one slice of pie.  That didn't matter because we still had three slice to take back to our hotel fridge.

I would totally suggest that if you have time, drive into historic Billings and  give this place a try.

data.title: I Felt Like a regular by the time I left
data.text: It was a Saturday night, first time in Billings and I was walking around getting a sense of downtown, taking a few pictures and running into several stores that I would definitely come back to look around If I didn't have to leave for Missoula Sunday Morning.  I found myself on Montana Ave. around N 27th St and came across several art galleries and a few boutique type restaurants. One was  called Cafe Italia and it beckoned me to pass through it's doors. You would think that with one night to spend in Billings, Montana, I should look for a piece of Montana beef-steak...but hey you don't always have to act like a Roman when you're in Rome...do you?  Upon entering I was cognizant of being made to feel right at home by both the hostess and the waitress. I sat at the bar and had extended conversations with both ( when they had a few free moments) about several of the dishes offered. They asked me why I was in town, and when I mentioned my road trip additional free moments were spent exchanging road trip sniglets. I love sitting at the bar when I eat alone. If you are a people person you always have someone to talk to as long as you can style your conversation to 20 - 40 second chucks while the waitress/bartender/hostess are between helping someone else. My Waitress recommended a great choice for my meal ( Mac & Cheese w/ parmesan/cheddar cheese, prosciutto and bread crumbs) and great wine to accompany the meal. However what was really great was how sincerely nice the people were when I left...I did feel like I was a regular...I felt like Norm on Cheers.

data.title: Great service & Great food
data.text:
We went for a walk downtown Billings and wandered into Cafe Italia. We were greeted right away. 
Our waitress made excellent dining and drink suggestions. Kids enjoyed their Italian sodas and homemade peanut butter gelato. 
We were treated like family, Italian style!

data.title: A nice little place
data.text: A few of us visited this little cafe. It had just been remodeled, and it was very nice. The service wasn't too bad. The food was pretty good. The only negative was that there was too much oil and grease at the bottom of each place. Never-the-less, I would recommend it to anyone.
